DOC.detailed_description: The propose study randomize controlled clinical trial , compare efficacy two cognitive-behavioral therapy ( CBT ) intervention : standard CBT substance dependence novel integrate CBT program PTSD substance dependence . The study run approximately 3 year . A total 100 participant enrol rate 4 participant per month 25 month ensure 80 participant complete protocol ( presume 20 % attrition ) . Each participant attend 12 treatment session , meet twice per week 6 week . Treatment session last 1-hour . Primary study outcome include frequency quantity substance use PTSD symptom severity . Substance use-related outcome include : rate substance abstinence , measure ( 1 ) urine toxicology testing , ( 2 ) alcohol breath level analysis , ( 3 ) participant ' self-report substance use . PTSD symptom outcome include symptom severity rating measure clinical interview ( i.e. , Clinician-Administered PTSD Scale-5 ; CAPS-5 ) self-report ( Posttraumatic Checklist ; PCL-5 ) . Secondary study outcome include examination mediational effect . Specifically , change distress tolerance , indexed via self-report ( Distress Tolerance Scale ) computer/behavioral task ( i.e. , Mirror-Tracing Task , Paced Auditory Serial Addition Task-Computerized Version , Breath-Holding Task ) , expect course treatment . Changes cue reactivity also expect course treatment , index decreased psychophysiological reactivity ( heart rate , respiration rate ) script-driven imagery task ( listen trauma/drug relate script vs. netural ) . A total four session ( baseline/screening session 4 , 8 , 12 ) precede laboratory session .
